channel.title: Latest alerts from washingtonpost.com
channel.description: An unofficial feed created by Derek Willis.

item.title: Lanternfly honey has arrived. Just don’t ask how it’s made.
item.description: The impact of spotted lanternflies is showing up in a less obvious way: It’s changing honey. Exactly how that change happens may not be the best selling point.

item.title: Donald Trump’s Kennedy Center is showier, emptier and more political
item.description: The center is now guided by a board of Trump loyalists and a new staff, including its president, Richard Grenell. Nearly 10 months in, a picture of the transformed institution has come into view as its biggest night approaches: the Kennedy Center Honors.

item.title: The College Football Playoff bracket is set. See who made the 12-team field.
item.description: The field and bracket were released by the CFP selection committee Sunday afternoon. The event begins with four first-round games at campus sites Dec. 19 and 20, and it concludes with the national championship game Jan. 19 in Miami Gardens, Florida.

item.title: Still need to finish this weekend’s On the Record? We’ve got you.
item.description: Still need to finish this weekend’s On the Record? We’ve got you.

item.title: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now
item.description: Crossword and a coffee: Solve the Sunday puzzle now

item.title: The mother of Karoline Leavitt’s nephew rejects the White House’s narrative of her ICE arrest
item.description: Bruna Ferreira, who chose the White House press secretary as her son’s godmother, said in an interview that it is insulting to sit in orange prison scrubs facing possible removal to Brazil while the Trump administration paints her as a criminal and an absentee mother.

item.title: A planned copper mine threatens a sacred Apache tradition
item.description: A girl's coming-of-age ceremony could be the last at Oak Flat before copper mining potentially transforms the site in Arizona.

item.title: For years, she was told it was stress. Then a brain scan revealed the real cause.
item.description: After years of misdiagnoses and unexplained symptoms, Annie Sedoric finally discovered the rare condition that was reshaping her body.

item.title: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.
item.description: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.

item.title: Rosie O’Donnell moved to Ireland to escape Trump. Did it work?
item.description: The American entertainer fled to the Emerald Isle when Donald Trump returned to the White House. Even with an ocean between them, their long feud boils on. But her new country has transformed her.

item.title: I suspected a hidden killer lurked inside my body. Here’s what I found.
item.description: Like many emerging technologies, Dana Milbank observes, this one can improve our lives, make us miserable or both. Nobody knows yet which it will be.

item.title: Frank Gehry dies at 96. The architect’s unearthly but brilliant designs became global landmarks.
item.description: Gehry was considered one of the most imaginative and expressive architects of his generation and ranked among the most important designers since Frank Lloyd Wright.

item.title: The World Cup group stage is set. The U.S. men’s national team will open against Paraguay.
item.description: As the opponents were drawn during Friday’s event at the Kennedy Center in Washington, the U.S. men’s national soccer team learned it will face Australia, Paraguay and a European playoff winner in Group D. Coach Mauricio Pochettino’s American squad will open play against Paraguay on June 12 at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.

item.title: Supreme Court will hear case on Trump’s ban on birthright citizenship
item.description: The announcement sets up a test of a controversial policy that could redefine who is considered an American.

item.title: Carolyn Hax chat: Mom’s over-the-top Christmas leaves no room for what I want
item.description: Carolyn Hax chat: Mom’s over-the-top Christmas leaves no room for what I want

item.title: FIFA’s stage is set, with Trump and soccer in the spotlight at the Kennedy Center. Follow our coverage.
item.description: Soccer teams will learn their group stage opponents at the draw for the 2026 World Cup, which will be held in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

item.title: CDC panel makes most sweeping revision to child vaccine schedule under RFK Jr.
item.description: The panel voted to eliminate a long-standing recommendation for every newborn to receive a hepatitis B shot, excluding those born to mothers testing negative.

item.title: 10 questions, and don't forget the bonus wager! Finish off your week with On the Record.
item.description: Think you’ve got what it takes to earn a perfect score? Take today’s longer news quiz and complete your point total for the week.

item.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in $83 billion cash-stock deal
item.description: The largest streaming network says it will purchase Warner Bros.’ studios and streaming assets after winning a bidding war with Comcast and Paramount.

item.title: Boat strike. Redistricting fight. Pipe bomb suspect. Trump’s ballroom. Pesticides. Social media ban. Black Death. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Video shows a second U.S. military strike on alleged drug smugglers hit before survivors could flip boat, lawmakers say
item.description: The footage was shown on Capitol Hill, where Adm. Frank M. Bradley faced a day of difficult questions about the deadly operation he oversaw.

item.title: Supreme Court hands Trump a victory in fight over Texas congressional map
item.description: The court has cleared the way for a voting map in Texas that could allow Republicans to win up to five additional seats in the House.

item.title: Grand jury refuses to reindict Letitia James in mortgage fraud case
item.description: The Trump administration had sought a new indictment in Virginia after a judge had dismissed a case against the New York attorney general last week.

item.title: Maryland House speaker steps down from role where she made history
item.description: Adrienne A. Jones was the first Black person and first woman to lead the Maryland House of Delegates. She said it was time for a new generation to lead.

item.title: ‘Signalgate’ report contradicts Hegseth’s claim of ‘total exoneration’
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s actions “created a risk to operational security,” according to an independent assessment publicly released Thursday by the Pentagon’s inspector general.

item.title: Trump replaces architect he handpicked to design his $300 million White House ballroom
item.description: It is unclear whether James McCrery II stepped back voluntarily. The president has chosen architect Shalom Baranes, who has been designing and renovating government buildings in Washington for decades, to continue the project, according to two people familiar with the situation.

item.title: Ominous maps of a falling fortress city reveal a change in Ukraine war
item.description: Putting Russia’s campaign to capture Pokrovsk into perspective.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Friends refuse to disclose why they’re divorcing after 20 years
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Friends refuse to disclose why they’re divorcing after 20 years

item.title: Closing a fashion deal in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Thursday points.

item.title: Kiss’s Gene Simmons: Congress, I have a plea for you
item.description: Long ago, broadcast radio helped bands like Kiss break through. Today, that business model is broken.

item.title: FBI arrests suspect in investigation of pipe bombs planted near RNC and DNC headquarters night before Jan. 6
item.description: Federal officials have arrested a man who is believed to have planted the pipe bombs, according to three people familiar with the matter. The arrest could bring closure to a mystery that has vexed law enforcement for five years.

item.title: America’s road safety plan has failed. This woman’s death reveals why.
item.description: U.S. officials encouraged cities to adopt Vision Zero to save lives, but driver opposition and a lack of money derailed it. The program has foundered in city after city, according to an examination of pedestrian death data by The Washington Post.

item.title: Hegseth scrutiny. Trump pardon. Vaccine vote. Syria brutality. Pedestrian deaths. Amazon delivery. Airport pajamas. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Data management giant Palantir deepens its ties to ICE as its CEO forms an alliance with Trump on immigration
item.description: Palantir’s software is helping U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement track undocumented immigrants and deport them faster, according to federal procurement filings and interviews with people who have knowledge of the project. CEO Alex Karp, formerly an outspoken Democrat who a decade ago said that he respected “nothing” about Donald Trump, has staunchly defended the president’s immigration policies.

item.title: A dozen former FDA commissioners condemn plans to tighten vaccine approvals, warning of risks to Americans’ health
item.description: The former Food and Drug Administration leaders wrote they were “deeply concerned” with new plans the nation’s top vaccine regulator, Vinay Prasad, laid out in a leaked internal email Friday. They argued that his approach could delay the arrival of vaccines better matched for evolving viruses, make it too expensive for new shots to come to market and slow the expanded approval of vaccines.

item.title: Doctor sentenced to 30 months in prison over Matthew Perry’s death from ketamine
item.description: Salvador Plasencia, who pleaded guilty in July to multiple drug charges in connection to the “Friends” star’s death, was sentenced Wednesday. He was initially charged alongside four others in 2024 after an investigation into Perry’s fatal overdose at age 54 the previous year.

item.title: Hegseth violated security protocols designed to protect U.S. troops in ‘Signalgate’ affair, top Pentagon watchdog finds
item.description: The inspector general inquiry centers on Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s use of the unclassified commercial messaging app Signal to share highly sensitive U.S. attack plans, according to four people familiar with the findings. The report, due to be released Thursday, appears certain to reignite an issue that has dogged Hegseth for much of his tenure.

item.title: Trump says he will pardon Democratic Rep. Henry Cuellar of Texas. He was charged with bribery, money laundering and conspiracy.
item.description: President Donald Trump says he will also pardon Cuellar’s wife, Imelda. The couple’s indictment detailed a bold corruption scheme in which Henry Cuellar, one of the most conservative Democrats in the House, allegedly promised to wield his power to advocate for his benefactors.

item.title: Homeland Security launches immigration sting in New Orleans, the latest in a series of sweeps nationwide
item.description: City residents had anticipated the operation, particularly immigrants. Some businesses had closed while others posted signs saying, “ICE not welcome here.”

item.title: College football drama in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Wednesday points.

item.title: Immigration pause. Pete Hegseth. Special election. Kids’ vaccines. Cold records. Lonely Americans. Blocking the sun. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Republican wins Tennessee special election in Trump country, as Democrats gain ground
item.description: GOP nominee Matt Van Epps defeated Democrat Aftyn Behn in Tennessee’s ruby-red 7th Congressional District, the Associated Press projected. The contest, which became more competitive than initially expected, was the latest test of voter attitudes about President Donald Trump’s agenda and Democrats’ response.

item.title: Holocaust museum gets the pen that was used to save dozens of children at Auschwitz
item.description: Erno Spiegel’s fountain pen was a subtle weapon in the fight for survival in a Nazi concentration camp.

item.title: Trump rails against Somali migrants: ‘I don’t want them in our country’
item.description: President Donald Trump ended a Cabinet meeting Tuesday with a rant against Somali migrants, accusing them of having “ripped off” Minnesota and using dehumanizing language to attack a group he has increasingly targeted in recent weeks. The president’s comments came amid reports that his administration is ramping up immigration enforcement efforts targeting undocumented Somali immigrants in the Minneapolis-St. Paul area.

item.title: This moral slum of an administration is sickening, George F. Will writes
item.description: Regarding Venezuela, Ukraine and much more, Trump and his acolytes are worse than simply incompetent.

item.title: National Guard shooting suspect charged with murder, assault offenses
item.description: U.S. Attorney Jeanine Pirro has said the suspect, Rahmanullah Lakanwal, will face additional charges as the investigation continues.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Parents at odds over ‘wicked smart’ teen who’s behind in four APs
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Parents at odds over ‘wicked smart’ teen who’s behind in four APs

item.title: A D.C. wedding in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Tuesday points

item.title: RFK Jr.’s vaccine advisers plan biggest change yet to childhood schedule
item.description: The new chair of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices says the panel is preparing this week to vote to end universal hepatitis B vaccination at birth and to examine whether childhood shots are triggering allergies and autoimmune disorders. Public health groups accuse the group of spreading misinformation.

item.title: Former president of Honduras freed from U.S. prison after Trump pardon
item.description: Juan Orlando Hernández had been sentenced last year to 45 years in prison after being convicted in a U.S. court of running a “narco-state” that helped send South American cocaine to the United States.
